summary: "Ferris Bueller's Day Off" is a funny movie from 1986 about a high school student, Ferris, who skips school with his friends for a fun day in Chicago. They visit cool places like the Sears Tower and the Art Institute. The movie shows Ferris breaking the "fourth wall" to share his thoughts directly with the audience. It was made by John Hughes, who wrote it in less than a week. The film was a big hit and is now considered an important part of American cinema.
title: Ferris Bueller's Day Off
